In [1]:
import random
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

infection¶

  • check only healthy cells
  • count sick neighbors
  • compute $p=1-(1-p_I)^k$
  • probability check
In [2]:
p=0.7653 # probability of infection computed using p_I
r=random.random() # random draw to check if a cell will get infected
In [3]:
print(r)

0.280296835620809
In [4]:
r<p
Out[4]:
True

In my case above the cell is getting sick

recovery¶

  • check only sick cells
  • compute $p=p_R$
  • probability check

Part 4: vaccine¶

  • During setup
  • $p_V$: percentage of vaccinated cells
  • probability check
In [5]:
# For each cell, at setup
pv=0.2
r=random.random()
In [6]:
pv>r
Out[6]:
True

The person above is not vaccinated

Fixing random seed to allow reproducibility (optional)¶

In [7]:
random.seed(21) #TO fix random seed. (optional) put once at beginning of project (after import)
print(random.random())
print(random.random())

0.16494947983319797
0.6897669242175674
In [8]:
np.random.seed(33)
np.random.random()
Out[8]:
0.24851012743772993

File operations¶

open() which opens (or create) a text file. write() can be used to write in a file

In [9]:
f=open('grocery.txt','w') # 'w' stands for writing mode
f.write('Chips\n') # \n is the newline character
f.write('Nutella\n')
f.write('Twinkies\n')
f.close() # necessary to close the file. Very important not to forget this!
In [10]:
mystr='Your head is filling up can\'t concentrate on much'
In [11]:
pwd
Out[11]:
'C:\\Users\\scassani\\Box\\buffalo_teaching_ubbox\\MTH337_S20\\in_class'
In [12]:
f=open('grocery.txt','a') # 'a' stands for append mode
f.write('toilet paper\n')
f.write('candies\n')
f.close()

Reading

In [13]:
f=open('grocery.txt','r') # 'r' stands for reading mode
a=f.read()
print(a)

Chips
Nutella
Twinkies
toilet paper
candies
In [14]:
b=f.read()
print(b)





















This happened since we are stuck at the end of the file. tell() returns the position (in bytes)













In [15]:



    


f.tell()



    















    
Out[15]:








49





















seek(n) moves us in position n













In [16]:



    


f.seek(0)
f.tell()



    















    
Out[16]:








0



















In [17]:



    


c=f.read(10) # read 10 chars
print(c)



    















    






Chips
Nute



















In [18]:



    


print(f.read(2))



    















    






ll





















readlines() read all the lines and returns a list













In [19]:



    


f.seek(0)
f.readlines()



    















    
Out[19]:








['Chips\n', 'Nutella\n', 'Twinkies\n', 'toilet paper\n', 'candies\n']



















In [20]:



    


f.close()



    















Alternative way of opening files which do not require close()













In [21]:



    


with open('grocery.txt','r') as f:
    a=f.readlines()
    print(a[:2])



    















    






['Chips\n', 'Nutella\n']



















In [22]:



    


with open('grocery.txt','r') as f:
    a=f.readline() # read one line
    print(a)



    















    






Chips






















To read only the first 2 lines













In [23]:



    


with open('grocery.txt','r') as f:
    for k in range(2):
        print(f.readline()) # read one line
        #print(a)



    















    






Chips

Nutella






















Ex. Add your grocery list to piazza:


    

  1. There should be at least 3 products on the list
    2. 

  2. The last line should be your first name, last name
    3. 
















Request¶












In [24]:



    


import requests # module to communicate with web pages



    













In [25]:



    


ubm=requests.get('http://www.math.buffalo.edu')
dir(ubm)



    















    
Out[25]:








['__attrs__',
 '__bool__',
 '__class__',
 '__delattr__',
 '__dict__',
 '__dir__',
 '__doc__',
 '__enter__',
 '__eq__',
 '__exit__',
 '__format__',
 '__ge__',
 '__getattribute__',
 '__getstate__',
 '__gt__',
 '__hash__',
 '__init__',
 '__init_subclass__',
 '__iter__',
 '__le__',
 '__lt__',
 '__module__',
 '__ne__',
 '__new__',
 '__nonzero__',
 '__reduce__',
 '__reduce_ex__',
 '__repr__',
 '__setattr__',
 '__setstate__',
 '__sizeof__',
 '__str__',
 '__subclasshook__',
 '__weakref__',
 '_content',
 '_content_consumed',
 '_next',
 'apparent_encoding',
 'close',
 'connection',
 'content',
 'cookies',
 'elapsed',
 'encoding',
 'headers',
 'history',
 'is_permanent_redirect',
 'is_redirect',
 'iter_content',
 'iter_lines',
 'json',
 'links',
 'next',
 'ok',
 'raise_for_status',
 'raw',
 'reason',
 'request',
 'status_code',
 'text',
 'url']



















In [26]:



    


ubm.status_code # 200 is good



    















    
Out[26]:








200



















In [27]:



    


nyt=requests.get('http://www.nytimes.com/pippo')
nyt.status_code



    















    
Out[27]:








404



















In [28]:



    


print(ubm.headers)



    















    






{'Date': 'Wed, 15 Apr 2020 17:48:45 GMT', 'Server': 'Apache/2.4.6 () Communique/4.2.3 OpenSSL/1.0.2k-fips', 'Last-Modified': 'Wed, 15 Apr 2020 17:48:48 GMT', 'ETag': 'W/"1d242-5a357eda6b78c-gzip"', 'Accept-Ranges': 'bytes', 'Vary': 'Accept-Encoding,User-Agent', 'Content-Encoding': 'gzip', 'Cache-Control': 'max-age=10', 'Expires': 'Wed, 15 Apr 2020 17:48:55 GMT', 'Content-Length': '17193', 'Keep-Alive': 'timeout=5, max=100', 'Connection': 'Keep-Alive', 'Content-Type': 'text/html; charset=UTF-8'}



















In [29]:



    


print(ubm.text)

Several of our faculty members are recipients of the SUNY Chancellor's Award for Excellence in Teaching. A strong tradition of mentorship attracts the most promising individuals and supports their development.</p></div><div class="teaser-links"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946904"><ul class="link-list" data-columnize="1"><li><span class="teaser teaser-inline"> <a href="/cas/math/research.html"> <span class="teaser-inner"> <!--noindex--> <span class="teaser-date">8/20/19</span> <!--endnoindex--> <span class="teaser-title">Faculty Research</span> </span> </a> </span></li></ul></div><div class="clearfix"></div></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></div><div class="slide slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946922" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/grad/master-program/focus.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/math-ma1/jcr:content/module.img.448.186.q50.jpg/1543259748626.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/math-ma1/jcr:content/module.img.576.240.q50.jpg/1543259748626.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/math-ma1/jcr:content/module.img.688.286.q80.jpg/1543259748626.jpg"><img height="400" alt="Mathematics MA: Focus on Applied and Interdisciplinary Mathematics. The Mathematics MA includes an internship with a leading industry partner. APPLY TODAY.</p></div><div class="teaser-links"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946934"><ul class="link-list" data-columnize="1"><li><span class="teaser teaser-inline"> <a href="/cas/math/grad/master-program/focus.html"> <span class="teaser-inner"> <!--noindex--> <span class="teaser-date">8/28/19</span> <!--endnoindex--> <span class="teaser-title">Learn More</span> </span> </a> </span></li></ul></div><div class="clearfix"></div></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></div><div class="slide slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946942" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/people/faculty.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/leaders/jcr:content/module.img.448.186.q50.jpg/1504661620217.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/leaders/jcr:content/module.img.576.240.q50.jpg/1504661620217.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/leaders/jcr:content/module.img.688.286.q80.jpg/1504661620217.jpg"><img height="400" alt="Leaders in the Field. Cultivating excellence, collegiality, and diversity, our faculty observe the highest standards of ethics, integrity, and professionalism.</p></div><div class="teaser-links"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946969"><ul class="link-list" data-columnize="1"><li><span class="teaser teaser-inline"> <a href="/cas/math/people/faculty.html"> <span class="teaser-inner"> <!--noindex--> <span class="teaser-date">2/24/20</span> <!--endnoindex--> <span class="teaser-title">Faculty Directory</span> </span> </a> </span></li></ul></div><div class="clearfix"></div></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></div><div class="slide slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817946980" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/research.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/variety/jcr:content/module.img.448.186.q50.jpg/1436887771785.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/variety/jcr:content/module.img.576.240.q50.jpg/1436887771785.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/home1/variety/jcr:content/module.img.688.286.q80.jpg/1436887771785.jpg"><img height="400" alt="MATH ADVANTAGE. The Department of Mathematics provides a variety of concentrations leading to Baccalaureate, Masters, and PhD degrees.</p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></div></div><div class="lSAction"><a tabindex="-1" class="lSPrev"><span class="ada-hidden">previous</span></a><a tabindex="-1" class="lSNext"><span class="ada-hidden">next</span></a></div></div><script>
        jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .slide:eq(0)').removeClass('slide-hidden');
    </script><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function() {
            setTimeout(function() {
                var slider = jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .slides').lightSlider({
                    item: 1, gallery: false, pager: true, controls: false, mode: 'fade', loop: true, keyPress: true
                });
                jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .lSPrev').click(function() { slider.goToPrevSlide(); return false });
                jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .lSNext').click(function() { slider.goToNextSlide(); return false });
                jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .slide').each(function (indx) {
                    jQuery(this).removeClass('slide-hidden');
                    jQuery(this).on('focus', '*', function() {
                        slider.goToSlide( indx + 1 );
                    });
                    setTimeout(function() {
                        jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817946886 .lSPager a[href="#"]').attr('tabindex', -1);
                    });
                });
            });
        });

" width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/cas/math/jcr%3acontent/col-1/flexmodule.img.209.131.jpg/1584992916273.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/jcr:content/col-1/flexmodule.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1584992916273.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/ug/help-center.html">MATHEMATICS ON-LINE HELP CENTER</a></div><div class="teaser-body"><p><b><a href="/cas/math/ug/help-center.html" target="_blank">WE ARE OPEN DAILY:</a></b></p><ul><li><b>Monday to Friday,<br/> 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.</b></li><li><b>Saturday, 2:00 to 6:00 p.m.&nbsp;</b></li><li><b>Sunday, 5:00 to 9:00 p.m.</b></li></ul><p>Our students take advantage of free, on-line tutoring, advice, and resources to help them succeed in courses for MTH 121, 122, 131, 141, 142, 241, 306, 309, and more.<br/></p></div><div class="teaser-links"><div class="list parbase"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947028"><ul class="link-list" data-columnize="1"><li><span class="teaser teaser-inline"> <a href="/cas/math/ug/help-center.html"> <span class="teaser-inner"> <!--noindex--> <span class="teaser-date">3/24/20</span> <!--endnoindex--> <span class="teaser-title">Mathematics Help Center</span> </span> </a> </span></li></ul></div><div class="clearfix"></div></div></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div><div class="flexmodule-clear"></div></div></div></div><div class="homepromo"><div class="col-2 parsys"><div class="carousel list parbase section"><div class="title"><h2>NEW &amp; NOTEWORTHY</h2></div><div id="ubcms-gen-817947039" class="size-5"><div class="nav"><a tabindex="-1" class="prev" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">previous</span> </a> <a tabindex="-1" class="next" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">next</span> </a></div><ul><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="page"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947041" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020.html" target="_blank"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1582759336032.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1582759336032.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.209.131.jpg/1582759336032.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Dr. Naoki Masuda receives the JSPS (Japan Society for Promotion of Science) Prize 2020, in recognition of his work, &ldquo;Pioneering Research on Theory and Data-analysis Methods for Temporal Networks&rdquo;. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/_jcr_content/par/image_1964998436.img.209.131.jpg/1582759336032.jpg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1582759336032.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1582759336032.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.209.131.jpg/1582759336032.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Dr. Naoki Masuda receives the JSPS (Japan Society for Promotion of Science) Prize 2020, in recognition of his work, &ldquo;Pioneering Research on Theory and Data-analysis Methods for Temporal Networks&rdquo;. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr%3acontent/par/image_1964998436.img.209.131.jpg/1582759336032.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020/jcr:content/par/image_1964998436.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1582759336032.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/news-events/news/masuda-jsps-prize-2020.html" target="_blank">Naoki Masuda wins JSPS Prize 2020</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">2/26/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">The University at Buffalo Department of Mathematics is pleased to announce that Dr.&nbsp;Naoki Masuda, Associate Professor, is the winner of the JSPS (Japan Society for Promotion of Science) Prize 2020. The national award recognizes his work, &ldquo;Pioneering Research on Theory and Data-Analysis Methods for Temporal Networks&rdquo;. Dr. Masuda attended the JSPS Awards Ceremony&nbsp;in February, 2020, accompanied by his daughter, Ami Masuda.&nbsp;The&nbsp;JSPS 2020 Award included full funding of their&nbsp;travel to Japan. While there, Dr. Masuda and Ami participated in an exclusive&nbsp;audience&nbsp;with the&nbsp;Japanese Royal Family.</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947050" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/math/a30706968/viral-triangle-brain-teaser-solved/?utm_source=2016+UB+Reporter%2C+University+at+Buffalo+List&utm_campaign=1ed86eef3c-UBNow_02_03_2020&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_af676811e4-1ed86eef3c-88033637" target="_blank"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1580832211217.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1580832211217.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1580832211217.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Johanna Mangahas, PhD. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/_jcr_content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1580832211217.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1580832211217.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1580832211217.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1580832211217.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Johanna Mangahas, PhD. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr%3acontent/module.img.209.131.jpg/1580832211217.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/news-2/crafty-combinatorics/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1580832211217.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/math/a30706968/viral-triangle-brain-teaser-solved/?utm_source=2016+UB+Reporter%2C+University+at+Buffalo+List&utm_campaign=1ed86eef3c-UBNow_02_03_2020&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_af676811e4-1ed86eef3c-88033637" target="_blank">Popular Mechanics: Crafty combinatorics solved by Johanna Mangahas </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">2/4/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p>According to Popular Mechanics, there&rsquo;s nothing quite like a&nbsp;maddening math problem,&nbsp;mind-bending optical illusion, or&nbsp;twisty logic puzzle&nbsp;to halt all productivity in the&nbsp;magazine's office. We&rsquo;re curious people by nature, but we also collectively share a stubborn insistence that we&rsquo;re&nbsp;right, and so we tend to throw work by the wayside whenever we come upon a problem with several seemingly possible solutions. Mathematicians such as Dr. Johanna Mangahas reveal the real answer.&nbsp;<b>How many triangles can you find in this <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/math/a30706968/viral-triangle-brain-teaser-solved/?utm_source=2016+UB+Reporter%2C+University+at+Buffalo+List&amp;utm_campaign=1ed86eef3c-UBNow_02_03_2020&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_term=0_af676811e4-1ed86eef3c-88033637" target="_blank">viral math problem?</a></b></p></div><div class="teaser-links"></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947062" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1579044680422.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1579044680422.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1579044680422.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Welcome new faculty. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/_jcr_content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1579044680422.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1579044680422.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1579044680422.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1579044680422.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Welcome new faculty. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr%3acontent/module.img.209.131.jpg/1579044680422.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-faculty/new-faculty-fall-2019/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579044680422.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title">Welcome new faculty</div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">1/14/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p>The UB Department of Mathematics is pleased to welcome new members of our faculty in AY 2019-2020:</p><p><b><a href="/cas/math/people/faculty/naoki-masuda.html">-Naoki Masuda</a>,</b>&nbsp;Associate Professor (Applied Mathematics);<br/> <br/> <b>-<a href="/cas/math/people/faculty/simone-cassani.html">Simone Cassani</a></b>, Visiting Assistant Professor (Applied Mathematics);<br/> <br/> <b>-<a href="/cas/math/people/faculty/Xin-ma.html">Xin Ma</a>,&nbsp;</b>Visiting<b>&nbsp;</b>Assistant Professor (Analysis; Operator Algebra);<br/> <br/> -<b><a href="/cas/math/people/faculty/margaret-nichols.html">Margaret Nichols</a>,&nbsp;</b>Visiting Assistant Professor (Geometric Topology);<br/> <br/> <b>-<a href="/cas/math/people/faculty/michael-rosas.html">Michael A. Rosas</a>,</b>&nbsp;Clinical Assistant Professor, Calculus Coordinator (Representation Theory, Mathematics Education)</p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="page"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947067" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity.html" target="_blank"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.png/1565892192930.png, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.png/1565892192930.png 2x"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.png/1565892192930.png"><source type="image/png" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.png/1565892192930.png, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1565892192930.png 2x"><img height="131" alt="Illustration courtesy of The Dana Foundation. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.png/1565892192930.png" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1565892192930.png 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.png/1565892192930.png, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.png/1565892192930.png 2x"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.png/1565892192930.png"><source type="image/png" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.png/1565892192930.png, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1565892192930.png 2x"><img height="131" alt="Illustration courtesy of The Dana Foundation. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.png/1565892192930.png" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1565892192930.png 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/news-events/news/Muldoon-pattern-diversity.html" target="_blank">Dana Foundation News: Muldoon’s research probes questions about individual differences in brain activity</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">8/16/19</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">New research from the University of Buffalo, using computational models of individual people&rsquo;s connectomes, shed light into individual differences in brain activation patterns, as well as how those patterns may change over time. Since 2009, scientists around the globe have worked to create&nbsp;the Human Connectome, a structural blueprint of the various neural pathways and connections that underlie thought, reason, emotion, and behavior in the brain. Thanks to those pioneering efforts, we now understand that different regions of the brain work together in concert, forming specific networks that facilitate movement, or learning, or our interactions with others&mdash;the cognitive skills that allow us to survive and thrive in our daily lives. Yet despite these advances, it&rsquo;s still not entirely clear how these networks may differ from person to person.&nbsp;Sarah Muldoon, a mathematician at the University of Buffalo, has long been interested in understanding individual differences in the brain.</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="page"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947072" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins.html" target="_blank"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556892999359.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556892999359.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892999359.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Mark Marino wins the 2018-2019 Milton Plesur Award for Excellence in Teaching. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892999359.jpg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556892999359.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556892999359.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892999359.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Mark Marino wins the 2018-2019 Milton Plesur Award for Excellence in Teaching. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892999359.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892999359.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/news-events/news/marino-wins.html" target="_blank">Mark Marino wins Milton Plesur Award 2018-2019</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">4/30/19</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">Congratulations to Mark Marino on winning the 2018-2019 Milton Plesur Award for Excellence in Teaching. This award is given by the UB Student Association on behalf of the students who nominate their instructors. The award carries the honor of being recognized as an outstanding professor by the students they teach. Marino was presented the award at the organization's annual event, April 29, 2019. <b><a href="http://www.buffalo.edu/ubnow/stories/2019/07/plesur-awards.html" target="_blank">Read more in UBNow.</a></b></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li></ul></div><script>jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947039 > ul > li:eq(0)').removeClass('slide-hidden');</script><script>
                jQuery(document).ready(function () {
                    var slider = jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947039 > ul').lightSlider({
                        item: 1, gallery: false, pager: false, controls: false, slideMargin: 10, adaptiveHeight: true,
                        responsive: [
                            { breakpoint: 720, settings: { item: 2, slideMargin: 16 } },
                            { breakpoint: 400, settings: { item: 1, slideMargin: 16 } }
                        ]
                    });
                    jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947039 .prev').click(function() { slider.goToPrevSlide(); return false; });
                    jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947039 .next').click(function() { slider.goToNextSlide(); return false; });

                    jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947039 .flexmodule-style.flexmodule-style-largeimg').each(function (indx) {
                        var $this = jQuery(this);
                        $this.removeClass('slide-hidden');
                        $this.on('focus', '*', function () {
                            slider.goToSlide(indx);
                            $this.closest('div.lSSlideWrapper').scrollLeft(0);
                        });
                    });
                });
        </script></div></div></div><div class="homepromo"><div class="col-3 parsys"><div class="carousel list parbase section"><div class="title"><h2>Our students</h2></div><div id="ubcms-gen-817947078" class="size-6"><div class="nav"><a tabindex="-1" class="prev" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">previous</span> </a> <a tabindex="-1" class="next" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">next</span> </a></div><ul><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="unstructuredpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947079" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556643573882.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556643573882.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556643573882.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Congratulations to Destiny Diaz, winner of the 2019 SUNY Chancellor&rsquo;s Award for Student Excellence. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556643573882.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556643573882.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556643573882.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556643573882.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Congratulations to Destiny Diaz, winner of the 2019 SUNY Chancellor&rsquo;s Award for Student Excellence. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556643573882.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556643573882.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/destiny-diaz.detail.html">Destiny Diaz wins the 2019 SUNY Chancellor’s Award for Student Excellence</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">4/30/19</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">Congratulations to&nbsp;<b>Destiny Diaz</b>, winner of the 2019 SUNY Chancellor&rsquo;s Award for Student Excellence. Diaz will graduate with a bachelor of science in mathematics and a minor in Spanish. Her accomplishments as an undergraduate student include: University Honors College Scholar; Ambassador for the College of Arts and Sciences; Western New York Prosperity Fellow; Volunteer, Dominican Republic Alternative Spring Break; and more. Diaz&nbsp;has completed research on how to increase STEM enrollment, and works at Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center as a research apprentice. <a href="http://www.buffalo.edu/ubnow/stories/2019/03/chancellors-awards-student-excellence.html?utm_source=2016+UB+Reporter%2C+University+at+Buffalo+List&amp;utm_campaign=a0b41679a2-UBNow_03_29_2019&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_term=0_af676811e4-a0b41679a2-88012129" target="_blank">See the award announcement in UB Now.</a></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="page"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947086" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556892228139.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556892228139.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892228139.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Destiny Diaz. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892228139.jpg" srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556892228139.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556892228139.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892228139.jpg, /content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Destiny Diaz. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556892228139.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556892228139.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/news-events/news/destiny-diaz-NSF-fellowship.html">Destiny Diaz wins NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Award</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">3/23/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">The University at Buffalo Department of Mathematics is pleased to announce that Destiny Diaz has won the National Science Foundation&rsquo;s Graduate Research Fellowship Award. The prestigious&nbsp;award is one of the most competitive and respected scientific fellowships in the U.S. &nbsp;Diaz is completing a BS in mathematics with a minor in Spanish. Recently, Diaz received 2019 SUNY Chancellor&rsquo;s Award for Student Excellence. A Buffalo native, she is a member of the University Honors College and a Prosperity Fellow. In Fall 2019, the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship&nbsp;will support her pursuit of graduate study in biostatistics at UB. The award provides three years of financial support within a five-year fellowship period, which amounts to a $34,000 annual stipend and $12,000 cost-of-education allowance to the graduate institution.</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="unstructuredpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947091" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556032789017.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556032789017.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556032789017.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="UB Student Team designated Meritorious Winner in the 2019 Mathematical Contest in Modeling. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556032789017.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1556032789017.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1556032789017.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556032789017.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="UB Student Team designated Meritorious Winner in the 2019 Mathematical Contest in Modeling. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1556032789017.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1556032789017.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mcm-2019.detail.html">UB Student Team excels in the 2019 Mathematical Contest in Modeling</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">4/23/19</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">Congratulations to the UB Student Team upon achieving the designation of Meritorious Winner in the 2019 Mathematical Contest in Modeling.&nbsp;The award puts the UB team in the top 8% of contestants. This year, 14,108 teams competed in the 35th Annual MCM Contest. The participating teams represented institutions from seventeen countries/regions from around the world. <b><a href="http://www.buffalo.edu/cas/math/people/faculty/ringland.html" target="_blank">John Ringland</a>,</b> Associate Professor and Associate Chair of UB Mathematics, served as faculty advisor for the UB student team.</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="unstructuredpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947101" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1579552261100.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1579552261100.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1579552261100.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt=", a junior majoring in Applied Mathematics, won the 2019 Summer Math Scholarship. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/_jcr_content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1579552261100.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1579552261100.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1579552261100.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1579552261100.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt=", a junior majoring in Applied Mathematics, won the 2019 Summer Math Scholarship. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1579552261100.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1579552261100.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/mondegarian-sms18.detail.html">Mondegarian wins the 2019 Math Summer Scholarship</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">1/20/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">Sanaira Mondegarian, a junior majoring in Applied Mathematics, has won the 2019 Math Summer Scholarship. The scholarship provided the opportunity for Saniara to study random matrix theory and applied network science under the guidance of Dr. Dane Taylor. Her research is concerned with the problem of community detection in complex networks.</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="highlightpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947108" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1584991598691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1584991598691.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1584991598691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="UB Actuarial student Mousa Sunnoqrot featured by AdvisorSmith. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/_jcr_content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1584991598691.jpg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1584991598691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1584991598691.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.209.131.jpg/1584991598691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="UB Actuarial student Mousa Sunnoqrot featured by AdvisorSmith. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr%3acontent/module.img.209.131.jpg/1584991598691.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/actuarial/jcr:content/module.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1584991598691.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.html">UB Actuarial student Mousa Sunnoqrot featured by AdvisorSmith</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">3/23/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p>Mousa Sunnoqrot is a senior at the State University of New York at Buffalo in Amherst, New York, where he is majoring in Mathematics and minoring in Economics and Statistics, with a concentration on Actuarial Science. Mousa is the professional chair for University at Buffalo&rsquo;s student-run Society of Future Actuaries, and he interned this past summer at Healthfirst in New York City. Mousa is featured in a Q&amp;A by <a href="https://advisorsmith.com/education/university-at-buffalo-actuarial-science-student-qa-mousa-sunnoqrot/" target="_blank">AdvisorSmith</a>, a provider of comprehensive research and advanced tools to better understand insurance for business professionals.</p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="unstructuredpage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947119" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1555084171534.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1555084171534.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1555084171534.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1555084171534.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1555084171534.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="1. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr%3acontent/par/image.img.209.131.jpg/1555084171534.jpg" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards/jcr:content/par/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1555084171534.jpg 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-students/2019-student-awards.detail.html">2019 Student Awards</a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">3/23/20</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body">UB's 15th Annual Celebration of Student Academic Excellence recognized five UB Mathematics students: Destiny Diaz, Michael Montoro, Julia V. Quebral, Anthony R. Taboni, and David Tallents. Our students are receiving various awards for outstanding work. The event began with the CURCA Poster Celebration, followed by the&nbsp;Awards Ceremony. The celebration, April 25, 2019, attracted a wide-range of UB community to the annual event to recognize the outstanding academic contributions of our students, faculty and research mentors.&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li></ul></div><div class="calltoaction"><span class="calltoaction-style-module"> <a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-students.html"> <span class="teaser-title">See more</span> </a> </span></div><script>jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947078 > ul').shuffle();</script><script>jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947078 > ul > li:eq(0)').removeClass('slide-hidden');</script><script>
                jQuery(document).ready(function () {
                    var slider = jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947078 > ul').lightSlider({
                        item: 1, gallery: false, pager: false, controls: false, slideMargin: 10, adaptiveHeight: true,
                        responsive: [

                        ]
                    });
                    jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947078 .prev').click(function() { slider.goToPrevSlide(); return false; });

                    jQuery('#ubcms\u002Dgen\u002D817947078 .flexmodule-style.flexmodule-style-largeimg').each(function (indx) {
                        var $this = jQuery(this);
                        $this.removeClass('slide-hidden');
                        $this.on('focus', '*', function () {
                            slider.goToSlide(indx);
                            $this.closest('div.lSSlideWrapper').scrollLeft(0);
                        });
                    });
                });
        </script></div></div></div><div class="homepromo-last"><div class="col-4 parsys"><div class="carousel list parbase section"><div class="title"><h2>Our Alumni</h2></div><div id="ubcms-gen-817947126" class="size-6"><div class="nav"><a tabindex="-1" class="prev" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">previous</span> </a> <a tabindex="-1" class="next" href="#"> <span class="ada-hidden">next</span> </a></div><ul><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947127" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1457811580614.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1457811580614.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1457811580614.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.jpg/1457811580614.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1457811580614.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Alyssa Thompson. </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">2/29/16</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/thompson.detail.html"><b>Alyssa Thompson, PhD, 2012<br/> UB Mathematics</b></a></p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947129" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1457216646432.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1457216646432.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1457216646432.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.jpg/1457216646432.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1457216646432.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Catherine (Cathy) M. </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">3/5/16</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/burzik.detail.html"><b>Catherine Burzik, MA '74<br/> UB Mathematics<br/> </b></a></p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947131" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1434039539647.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1434039539647.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1434039539647.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.jpg/1434039539647.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1434039539647.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Max Biileschi. It opened everything up.” </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">11/21/17</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/max-bileschi.detail.html"><b>Max Bileschi, BA, BCS, MA<br/> UB Mathematics and Computer Science<br/> </b></a></p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947133" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.png/1511360580824.png, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.png/1511360580824.png 2x"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.png/1511360580824.png"><source type="image/png" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.png/1511360580824.png, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1511360580824.png 2x"><img height="131" alt="Google Logo. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image" src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/_jcr_content/image.img.209.131.png/1511360580824.png" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1511360580824.png 2x"></picture></noscript><picture class="no-display"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 568px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.png/1511360580824.png, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.png/1511360580824.png 2x"><source type="image/png" media="(max-width: 720px)" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.png/1511360580824.png"><source type="image/png" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.png/1511360580824.png, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1511360580824.png 2x"><img height="131" alt="Google Logo. " width="209" class="img-209 img-209x131 cq-dd-image lazyload" data-src="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr%3acontent/image.img.209.131.png/1511360580824.png" src="//www.buffalo.edu/etc/designs/default/0.gif" data-srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.png/1511360580824.png 2x"></picture><script type="text/javascript">jQuery('picture.no-display').removeClass('no-display');</script></a></div></div><div class="teaser-content"><div class="teaser-title"><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach.detail.html"> &#34;My experience has been that machine learning is largely viewed as magic and even engineers often have a skewed perspective of what it can accomplish.&#34; </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">11/22/17</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/leach.detail.html"><b>Andrew Leach, Machine Learning Deployment Engineer, Google</b><br/> </a></p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947135" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1457210482691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1457210482691.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1457210482691.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.jpg/1457210482691.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1457210482691.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Geoffrey Fatin. That is very exciting to me, and it drives me further.” </a></div><!--noindex--><div class="teaser-date">3/12/16</div><!--endnoindex--><div class="teaser-body"><p><a href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/fatin.detail.html"><b>Geoffrey Fatin<br/> Double Major in Physics and Mathematics</b></a></p></div></div></div><div class="teaser-clear"></div></div></div></li><li class="flexmodule-style flexmodule-style-largeimg slide-hidden"><div class="facesvoicespage"><div id="ubcms-gen-817947137" class="teaser teaser-block "><div class="teaser-inner"><div aria-hidden="true" class="teaser-images"><div class="teaser-image"><a tabindex="-1" href="/cas/math/about-us/our-alumni/our-alumni.host.html/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford.detail.html"> <noscript><picture><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 568px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford/jcr:content/image.img.448.280.q50.jpg/1501875059168.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford/jcr:content/image.img.576.361.q50.jpg/1501875059168.jpg 2x"><source type="image/jpeg" media="(max-width: 720px)" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford/jcr:content/image.img.688.431.q80.jpg/1501875059168.jpg"><source type="image/jpeg" srcset="/content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford/jcr:content/image.img.209.131.jpg/1501875059168.jpg, /content/shared/cas/math/modules/our-alumni/n-sanford/jcr:content/image.img.418.262.q65.jpg/1501875059168.jpg 2x"><img height="131" alt="Natasha Sanford. Project Guthenberg¶












In [30]:



    


carrol=requests.get('http://www.gutenberg.org/cache/epub/35688/pg35688.txt').text



    













In [31]:



    


carrol



    















    
Out[31]:








'\ufeffThe Project Gutenberg EBook of Alice in Wonderland, by Alice Gerstenberg\r\n\r\nThis eBook is for the use of anyone anywhere at no cost and with\r\nalmost no restrictions whatsoever.  You may copy it, give it away or\r\nre-use it under the terms of the Project Gutenberg License included\r\nwith this eBook or online at www.gutenberg.net\r\n\r\n\r\nTitle: Alice in Wonderland\r\n       A Dramatization of Lewis Carroll\'s "Alice\'s Adventures in\r\n       Wonderland" and "Through the Looking Glass"\r\n\r\nAuthor: Alice Gerstenberg\r\n\r\nRelease Date: March 26, 2011 [EBook #35688]\r\n\r\nLanguage: English\r\n\r\n\r\n*** START OF THIS PROJECT GUTENBERG EBOOK ALICE IN WONDERLAND ***\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nProduced by The Online Distributed Proofreading Team at\r\nhttp://www.pgdp.net (This file was produced from images\r\ngenerously made available by The Internet Archive.)\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n[Illustration]\r\n\r\n[Illustration: ALICE: You\'re Humpty Dumpty! Just like an egg. [Page 24]]\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n  Alice in Wonderland\r\n\r\n  A dramatization of Lewis Carroll\'s\r\n  "Alice\'s Adventures in Wonderland" and\r\n  "Through the Looking Glass"\r\n\r\n\r\n  By Alice Gerstenberg\r\n\r\n  Author of "The Conscience of Sarah Platt",\r\n  "Unquenched Fire," "A Little World," etc.\r\n\r\n  Chicago\r\n  A.C.Mc.Clurg & Co.\r\n  1915\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n  Copyright\r\n  A. C. McCLURG & CO.\r\n  1915\r\n\r\n\r\n  Published December, 1915\r\n\r\n\r\n  Rights to produce this play in all countries of the world\r\n  are reserved by Alice Gerstenberg\r\n\r\n\r\n  W. F. MAEL PRINTING COMPANY, CHICAGO\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n[Illustration: TO THE MEMORY OF LEWIS CARROLL]\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nThis dramatic rendering of _Alice in Wonderland_, by Alice Gerstenberg of\r\nChicago, was produced by The Players Producing Company of Chicago (Aline\r\nBarnsdall and Arthur Bissell), at the Fine Arts Theater, Chicago, February\r\n11, 1915. After a successful run it opened at the Booth Theater, New York,\r\nMarch 23, 1915.\r\n\r\nThe scenery and the costumes were designed by William Penhallow Henderson\r\nof Chicago.\r\n\r\nThe music was written by Eric De Lamarter of Chicago.\r\n\r\nThe advertising posters and cards were designed by Jerome Blum of Chicago.\r\n\r\nThe illustrations of the characters of the play in this book were drawn by\r\nJ. Allen St. John from photographs by Victor Georg of Chicago.\r\n\r\nW. H. Gilmore staged the play with the following cast:\r\n\r\n  LEWIS CARROLL       Frank Stirling\r\n  ALICE               Vivian Tobin\r\n  RED QUEEN           Florence LeClercq\r\n  WHITE QUEEN         Mary Servoss\r\n  WHITE RABBIT        Donald Gallaher\r\n  HUMPTY DUMPTY       Alfred Donohoe\r\n  GRYPHON             Fred W. Permain\r\n  MOCK TURTLE         Geoffrey Stein\r\n  MAD HATTER          Geoffrey Stein\r\n  MARCH HARE          Fred W. Permain\r\n  DORMOUSE            J. Gunnis Davis\r\n  FROG FOOTMAN        Walter Kingsford\r\n  DUCHESS             Kenyon Bishop\r\n  CHESHIRE CAT        Alfred Donohoe\r\n  KING OF HEARTS      Frederick Annerly\r\n  QUEEN OF HEARTS     Winifred Hanley\r\n  KNAVE OF HEARTS     Foxhall Daingerfield\r\n  CATERPILLAR         Walter Kingsford\r\n  TWO OF SPADES       Rule Pyott\r\n  FIVE OF SPADES      France Bendtsen\r\n  SEVEN OF SPADES     John A. Rice\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nAlice in Wonderland\r\n\r\n\r\nTHE SCENES\r\n\r\nACT I\r\n\r\n  Scene I--Alice\'s Home.\r\n  Scene II--The Room in the Looking Glass.\r\n  Scene III--The Hall with Doors.\r\n  Scene IV--The Sea Shore.\r\n\r\nACT II\r\n\r\n  Scene----The March Hare\'s Garden.\r\n\r\nACT III\r\n\r\n  Scene I--The Garden of Flowers.\r\n  Scene II--The Court of Hearts.\r\n  Scene III--Alice\'s Home.\r\n\r\nMiss Gerstenberg\'s manuscript called for costumes after the illustrations\r\nof John Tenniel, and scenery of the simple imaginative type, the "new art"\r\nin the theater.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE IN WONDERLAND\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nAlice in Wonderland\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nACT I\r\n\r\n\r\nSCENE ONE\r\n\r\n_ALICE\'S home. LEWIS CARROLL is discovered, playing chess. Golden-haired\r\nALICE, in a little blue dress, a black kitten in her arms, stands watching\r\nhim._\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nThat\'s a funny game, uncle. What did you do then?\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nA red pawn took a white pawn; this way. You see, Alice, the chessboard is\r\ndivided into sixty-four squares, red and white, and the white army tries\r\nto win and the red army tries to win. It\'s like a battle!\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nWith soldiers?\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nYes, here are the Kings and Queens they are fighting for. That\'s the Red\r\nQueen and here\'s the White Queen.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nHow funny they look!\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nSee the crowns on their heads, and look at their big feet.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nIt\'s a foot apiece, that\'s what it is! Do they hump along like this?\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nHere! You\'re spoiling the game. I must keep them all in their right\r\nsquares.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nI want to be a queen!\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nHere _you_ are [_he points to a small white pawn_] here _you_ are in your\r\nlittle stiff skirt!\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nHow do you do, Alice!\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nAnd now you are going to move here.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nLet me move myself.\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nWhen you have traveled all along the board this way and haven\'t been taken\r\nby the enemy you may be a queen.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nWhy do people always play with kings and queens? Mother has them in her\r\nplaying cards too. Look!\r\n\r\n[_ALICE goes to the mantel and takes a pack of playing cards from the\r\nledge._]\r\n\r\nHere\'s the King of Hearts and here\'s his wife; she\'s the Queen of\r\nHearts--isn\'t she cross-looking? wants to bite one\'s head off.\r\n\r\n[_CARROLL moves a pawn._]\r\n\r\nYou\'re playing against yourself, aren\'t you?\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nThat\'s one way of keeping in practice, Alice; I have friends in the\r\nuniversity who want to beat me.\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nBut if you play against yourself I should think you\'d want to cheat!\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nDoes a nice little girl like you cheat when she plays against herself?\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nOh! I _never_ do! I\'d scold myself hard. I always pretend I\'m _two_ people\r\ntoo. It\'s lots of fun, isn\'t it? Sometimes when I\'m all alone I walk up to\r\nthe looking glass and talk to the other Alice. She\'s so silly, that Alice;\r\nshe can\'t do anything by herself. She just mocks me all the time. When I\r\nlaugh, she laughs, when I point my finger at her, she points her finger at\r\nme, and when I stick my tongue out at her she sticks her tongue out at me!\r\nKitty has a twin too, haven\'t you darling?\r\n\r\n[_ALICE goes to the mirror to show Kitty her twin._]\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nI\'ll have to write a book some day about Alice--Alice in wonderland,\r\n"Child of the pure unclouded brow and dreaming eyes of wonder!" or, Alice\r\nthrough the looking glass!\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nDon\'t you wish sometimes you could go into looking-glass house? See!\r\n\r\n[_ALICE stands on an armchair and looks into the mirror._]\r\n\r\nThere\'s the room you can see through the glass; it\'s just the same as our\r\nliving-room here, only the things go the other way. I can see all of\r\nit--all but the bit just behind the fireplace. Oh! I do wish I could see\r\nthat bit! I want so much to know if they\'ve a fire there. You never _can_\r\ntell, you know, unless our fire smokes. Then smoke comes up in that room\r\ntoo--but that may be just to make it look as if they had a fire--just to\r\npretend they had. The books are something like our books, only the words\r\ngo the wrong way. Won\'t there ever be any way of our getting through,\r\nuncle?\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\nDo you think Kitty would find looking-glass milk digestible?\r\n\r\n\r\nALICE\r\n\r\nIt doesn\'t sound awful good, does it; but I might leave her at home. She\'s\r\nbeen into an awful lot of mischief today. She found sister\'s knitting and\r\nchased the ball all over the garden where sister was playing croquet with\r\nthe neighbors. And I ran and ran after the naughty little thing until I\r\nwas all out of breath and so tired! I am tired.\r\n\r\n[_She yawns and makes herself comfortable in the armchair._]\r\n\r\n\r\nCARROLL\r\n\r\n[_Replaces the playing cards on the mantel and consults his watch._]\r\n\r\nTake a nap.
